data.title: North Dakota hockey: 1999
data.text:
Boston College vs. North Dakota

April 8, 2000

NCAA Championship

Providence Civic Center, Providence, RI (11,484)

1st Period

UND-1: Mike Commodore (Bryan Lundbohm, Tim Skarperud) 3:48

BC-1: Jeff Farkas (Blake Bellefuille, Brian Gionta) 16:47 ppg

2nd Period

BC-2: Marty Hughes (Brian Gionta) 6:59

3rd Period

UND-2: Lee Goren (Ryan Bayda) 2:43

UND-3: Jason Ulmer (Lee Goren) 14:22

UND-4: Lee Goren (unassisted) 19:14 eng

Penalties: UND 7-14; BC 4-8

Power Plays: UND 0-3; BC 1-6 Shots: UND 13-12-11--36; BC 13-6-4--23

Saves: UND Goehring 12-5-4--21/60:00; BC Clemmensen 12-12-8--32/58:47

1999-2000 Season Notes

North Dakota's 7th NCAA Championship was the first one played in the month of April

With the 2000 championship, Dean Blais had led the Sioux to two titles in five years behind the bench

Providence, R.I., has been home to three Sioux championships

Lee Goren of Winnipeg, Manitoba, led the nation and the WCHA in goals with 34

Jeff Panzer, Grand Forks, ND, was a Hobey Baker finalist

UND had been eliminated from the 1999 Tournament by Boston College in the Western regionals in Madison, WI

1999-2000: The road to victory

Boston College 4 Boston College 2 North Dakota

NCAA Champion St. Lawrence 2 North Dakota 2 North Dakota 4 Maine 0
